application_instruction: Note: By applying to this position your application is automatically submitted to the following locations: San Francisco, CA, USA; Mountain View, CA, USA
description:
At Google, we don't shy away from big, crazy ideas--and that's not just in our products. We aim to foster the healthiest workforce on the planet and our Benefits team is behind the wheel, driving these efforts. From retirement planning to financial literacy courses to healthy living campaigns, our Benefits team runs programs that are designed to keep our global Googlers healthy and happy. With more than 60 offices across the world, you're able to swiftly maneuver through the complexity of serving different legal and cultural practices, while also finding creative opportunities for giving our Googlers equitable support. You'll build an understanding of what "wellness' truly means to each Googler, and implement innovative programs as the population of Googlers grows in size and diversity. You are a mission-driven, enthusiastic team player with the creativity to develop and manage benefits programs.

We’re looking for a passionate numbers-oriented healthcare analyst that is passionate about making healthcare data and financials intuitive, transparent, and effective to drive decisions. In this role, you will be a key contributor in supporting Google’s effort to understand our costs and represent the numbers to senior leaders.

You are analytical in your approach, action-oriented and thrive in a fast-paced environment. You are the kind of person that is eager and “ready to roll up their sleeves” and willing to do whatever is needed to move an effort forward. You enjoy building solid working relationships with peers, cross functional teams and vendor partners. You have a proven track record of success setting and achieving ambitious goals.

Great just isn't good enough for our People Operations team (you probably know us better as "Human Resources"). Made up of equal parts HR professionals, former consultants, and analysts, we're the advocates of Google's colorful culture. In People Ops, we "find them, grow them, and keep them". We bring the world's most innovative people to Google and provide the programs that help them thrive. Whether recruiting the next Googler, refining our core programs, developing talent, or simply looking for ways to inject some more fun into the lives of our Googlers, we bring a data-driven approach that is reinventing the human resources field.
eeo: At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in Mathematics, Finance or equivalent practical experience.
  • 3 years experience in actuarial or health analytics in a commercial, self-insured employer-sponsored health plan segment.
  • Experience in health and wellness program evaluation (e.g. ROI analyses, actuarial scoring)

Preferred qualifications:

  • Benefits Consulting experience or Certified Employee Benefit Specialist (CEBS) or similar designation.
  • Society of Actuaries FSA credential, preferably Group and Health Track-designated.
  • Familiarity with commercial data warehouse platforms or similar ad hoc data reporting environments, including drill-downs on drivers of trend and provider-level analyses.
  • Strong communication and influencing skills; ability to build relationships and working collaboratively across multiple offices and geographies.
  • Organized, with a keen eye for detail; ability to manage competing priorities and multi-task with ease.
  • Strong analytical skills; ability to evaluate data and synthesize trends into actionable interventions and, ideally, broader plan strategy (e.g. plan design, network design, contribution strategy and other mission-critical decisions).
responsibilities:
• Look after the day-to-day needs of Google’s global Healthcare, Well-Being and Welfare plan financials including but not limited to: tracking budget vs. actual costs, developing recommendations for Googler health plan designs and contributions, and partnering with external actuaries.
  • Manage claims based and survey based analytics projects to identify opportunities to improve Googler health and well-being.
  • Partner with internal stakeholders to identify and refine the measurement our program evaluation framework for our health and welfare programs, including actuarial scoring and return-on-investment analysis.
  • Collaborate with People Health analytics teammates, benefits managers and vendor partners to represent the one source of truth for our health, Well-Being and welfare costs that is intuitive to a broad audience including leadership.
  • Manage other programs/projects in the global Benefits space, as needed.
title: Healthcare Financial Specialist
